  function loadCSS(e,t,n){"use strict";function o(){var t;for(var i=0;i&lt;s.length;i++){if(s[i].href&amp;&amp;s[i].href.indexOf(e)&gt;-1){t=true}}if(t){r.media=n||"all"}else{setTimeout(o)}}var r=window.document.createElement("link");var i=t||window.document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0];var s=window.document.styleSheets;r.rel="stylesheet";r.href=e;r.media="only x";i.parentNode.insertBefore(r,i);o();return r}
  loadCSS('/css/hash/4b84f60e9fb52ee404ba97e247968b70/dist/bdc-screen--non-critical.css');

  <script type="text/javascript">
   var googletag = googletag || {};
  googletag.cmd = googletag.cmd || [];

  function oxDone() {
    var gads = document.createElement("script");
    gads.async = true;
    gads.type = "text/javascript";
    var useSSL = "https:" == document.location.protocol;
    gads.src = (useSSL ? "https:" : "http:") + "//www.googletagservices.com/tag/js/gpt.js";
    var node = document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0];
    node.parentNode.insertBefore(gads, node);
  }

  setTimeout(function() { if (!('OX' in window)) {oxDone()}},5000);
  </script>
  <!-- Build Key/Value Object + Set adUnit Name -->
  <!-- do the fucking changes work or what? -->
  <script>
   // DFP Setup
    var bcom = bcom || {};
    bcom.dfp = bcom.dfp || {};
    bcom.dfp.networkCode = 61381659;
    bcom.dfp.adUnit = 'boston.com/entertainment/television';
    bcom.dfp.adSlots = ['ad_toprightslot','ad_outofpage3','ad_outofpage2','ad_outofpage1','ad_stream6','ad_stream5','ad_stream4','ad_stream3','ad_stream2','ad_stream1','ad_featurestack1','ad_lead1'];
    bcom.dfp.streamCount = '5';
    bcom.dfp.galleryCount = '';
    bcom.dfp.refreshRate = '';
    bcom.dfp.keyValuePairs = {
        
        s1: 'boston.com',
        s2: 'entertainment',
        s3: 'television',
        s4: '',
        s5: '',
        pgtype : 'article',
        pageurl : '_entertainment_tv_2015_01_01_wahlberg-poehler-power-ranking-the-year-best-actors-with-boston-ties_PgEyu3UnVPFuy5rHT1FBVO_story_html',
        meta: '',
        pos: ''
    };
  </script>
  <script src="//cdn.optimizely.com/js/1133775821.js">
  </script>
  <script src="/js/hash/96e94761b268a1c242f8548ef031cae5/dist/head.min.js" type="text/javascript">
  </script>
  <!-- webtype story section is /entertainment/tv -->
  <div class="out-of-page-ad" id="ad_richmedia">
  </div>
  <script id="wishabi_flyer" type="text/html">
   {{#flyers}}
	&lt;a class="feat-tz-img-mod  art-bd" href="{{imageLink}}"&gt;
		&lt;img class="feat-tz-img" src="{{imageSource}}"&gt;
	&lt;/a&gt; &lt;!-- feat-tz-img-mod --&gt;
	&lt;div class="feat-tz-bd txt-bd"&gt;
		&lt;h4 class="feat-tz-h tz-title"&gt;
			&lt;a href="{{flyerTextLink}}"&gt;{{flyerText}}&lt;/a&gt;
			&lt;img src="{{flyerViewTrack}}"/&gt;
		&lt;/h4&gt;
		&lt;ul class="tz-meta feat-tz-meta"&gt;
			&lt;li class="tz-meta-item tz-time"&gt;
				&lt;i class="tz-time-icon tz-meta-icon"&gt;&lt;/i&gt;
				&lt;i class="tz-time-text tz-meta-text"&gt;&lt;a  href="{{flyerSubTextLink}}"&gt;{{flyerSubText}}&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/i&gt;
                {{#flyerKeyMessageShortText}}
                &lt;i class="tz-meta-message"&gt;&lt;a href="{{flyerKeyMessageShortTextLink}}"&gt;{{flyerKeyMessageShortText}}&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/i&gt;
                {{/flyerKeyMessageShortText}}
			&lt;/li&gt;
			&lt;li class="tz-meta-item tz-category"&gt;
				&lt;a href="http://circulars.boston.com"&gt;Circulars&lt;/a&gt;
			&lt;/li&gt;
		&lt;/ul&gt; &lt;!-- /.tz-meta --&gt;
	&lt;/div&gt; &lt;!-- /feat-tz-bd --&gt;
	{{/flyers}}
	&lt;img src="{{moduleViewTrack}}" style="display:none;"/&gt;
  </script>

   &lt;header class="sb-hdr"&gt;

		&lt;i class="sb-txt-02 sb-txt-strong"&gt;{{segment_number}}&lt;/i&gt;
		{{#status}}
		&lt;i class="sb-sponsor-txt sb-txt-light"&gt;{{status}}&lt;/i&gt;
		{{/status}}
	&lt;/header&gt;
	&lt;div class="sb-body-mod"&gt;
		&lt;div class="sb-away-team"&gt;
			&lt;div class="sb-away-team-info sb-team-info"&gt;
				&lt;i class="sb-away-team-logo sb-team-logo sb-sport-{{sport}}" id="{{sport}}-{{awayTeam}}"&gt;&lt;/i&gt;
				&lt;h5 class="sb-away-team-name sb-team-name"&gt;{{awayTeam_name}}&lt;/h5&gt;
				&lt;h4 class="sb-away-team-score sb-team-score"&gt;{{awayScore}}&lt;/h4&gt;
			&lt;/div&gt;

   <section class="masthead masthead--navless-mobile" role="banner">
    <div class="masthead__content">
     <!-- BDC Hat -->
     <!-- https://github.com/chyingp/grunt-inline -->
     <style>
      .bdc-hat{position:relative;padding:3px 10px;background:#2a2a2a;font-family:verdana,sans-serif;font-size:11px;text-transform:uppercase;letter-spacing:1px}.bdc-hat:after{content:"";display:table;clear:both;*zoom:1}.bdc-hat__content{position:relative}.bdc-hat__list{display:none;position:absolute;top:100%;right:0;min-width:200px;padding:10px;background-color:#2a2a2a;border-top:1px solid #111;z-index:100}.bdc-hat__list--active{display:block}.bdc-hat__list-item{padding:10px;border-bottom:1px solid #aaa}.bdc-hat__list-item:last-child{border-bottom:0}.bdc-hat__list-item--secondary{display:block}.bdc-hat__list-link{color:#fff;text-decoration:none}.bdc-hat__list-link:hover{color:#fff}.bdc-hat__logo-button{float:right;margin-left:10px;color:#fff;text-decoration:none}.bdc-hat__logo-button:hover,.bdc-hat__logo-button:active,.bdc-hat__logo-button:focus{color:#fff}.bdc-hat__logo-button--secondary{display:none}.bdc-hat__logo-button--active .bdc-hat__button-carrot--down{display:none}.bdc-hat__logo-button--active .bdc-hat__button-carrot--up{display:inline-block}.bdc-hat__button-logo{display:block;float:left;width:20px;height:20px;background-repeat:no-repeat;background-image:url("http://cache.boston.com/universal/bdc-hat/icons/ico-sub-brand-bcom-bug.png")}.bdc-hat__button-text{display:inline-block;margin-left:5px;padding-top:4px}.bdc-hat__button-carrot{display:inline-block;margin-left:5px;padding-top:4px;position:relative;top:1px}.bdc-hat__button-carrot--up{display:none}@media(min-width:768px){.bdc-hat__list{display:block;position:static;float:right;padding:4px 0 0;border-top:0}.bdc-hat__list-item{float:left;border-bottom:0;border-right:1px solid #aaa;padding:0 10px}.bdc-hat__list-item:first-child{border-left:0}.bdc-hat__list-item:last-child{border-right:3px double #aaa}.bdc-hat__list-item--secondary{display:none}.bdc-hat__logo-button--primary{display:none}.bdc-hat__logo-button--secondary{display:block}}@media only screen and (-webkit-min-device-pixel-ratio:1.3),only screen and (-o-min-device-pixel-ratio:13 / 10),only screen and (min-resolution:120dpi){.bdc-hat__button-logo{background-image:url("http://cache.boston.com/universal/bdc-hat/icons/ico-sub-brand-bcom-bug-2x.png");background-size:20px 20px}}
     </style>
     <div class="bdc-hat">
      <a class="bdc-hat__logo-button bdc-hat__logo-button--primary" href="#" id="bdc-drop-hat-button" onclick="return false;">
       <span class="bdc-hat__button-logo">

       <span class="bdc-hat__button-logo">

     <script>
      !function(win,undefined){"use strict";function addEventListener(el,eventName,handler){el.addEventListener?el.addEventListener(eventName,handler):el.attachEvent("on"+eventName,function(){handler.call(el)})}function toggleClass(el,className){if(el.classList)el.classList.toggle(className);else{for(var classes=el.className.split(" "),existingIndex=-1,i=classes.length;i--;)classes[i]===className&amp;&amp;(existingIndex=i);existingIndex&gt;=0?classes.splice(existingIndex,1):classes.push(className),el.className=classes.join(" ")}}var clickTarget=document.getElementById("bdc-drop-hat-button"),dropDown=document.getElementById("bdc-hat-list");addEventListener(clickTarget,"click",function(){toggleClass(dropDown,"bdc-hat__list--active"),toggleClass(clickTarget,"bdc-hat__logo-button--active")})}(window);
     </script>

    <!-- Main Content Well -->
    <div class="content-well content-well--main content-well--article" role="main">
     <!-- Content Header -->
     <header class="content-header">
      <h1 class="content-header__headline">
       Wahlberg to Poehler, Power Ranking the Years 10 Best Actors With Boston Ties
      </h1>
      <h2 class="content-header__subheadline ">
      </h2>
     </header>
     <div>
      <!-- Content Media - Lead -->

      <div>
       <div class="content-social-bar content-social-bar--vertical js-share-bar nocontent js-sticky">
        <ul class="content-social-bar__list">
         <li class="content-social-bar__item">
          <a class="content-social-bar__button facebook-button js-gigya-share" data-canonical="http://www.boston.com/entertainment/tv/2015/01/01/wahlberg-poehler-power-ranking-the-year-best-actors-with-boston-ties/PgEyu3UnVPFuy5rHT1FBVO/story.html" data-cid="article_page_top_facebook" data-headline="Wahlberg to Poehler, Power Ranking the Years 10 Best Actors With Boston Ties" data-omniture="Gigya | sticky | facebook | " data-provider="facebook" data-thumb-type="image" data-thumbnail="http://c.o0bc.com/rw/SysConfig/WebPortal/BDC/Framework/img/bcom_logo_with_name.png" href="#">
           <span class="content-social-bar__button-icon bdc-icon bdc-icon--facebook-x-small">
           </span>
           <span class="content-social-bar__button-copy">
            Share
           </span>
           <span class="content-social-bar__button-count js-facebook-count">
            0
           </span>
          </a>
         </li>
         <li class="content-social-bar__item">
          <a class="content-social-bar__button twitter-button js-gigya-share" data-canonical="http://www.boston.com/entertainment/tv/2015/01/01/wahlberg-poehler-power-ranking-the-year-best-actors-with-boston-ties/PgEyu3UnVPFuy5rHT1FBVO/story.html" data-cid="article_page_top_twitter" data-headline="Wahlberg to Poehler, Power Ranking the Years 10 Best Actors With Boston Ties" data-omniture="Gigya | sticky | twitter | " data-provider="twitter" data-thumb-type="image" data-thumbnail="http://c.o0bc.com/rw/SysConfig/WebPortal/BDC/Framework/img/bcom_logo_with_name.png" href="#">
           <span class="content-social-bar__button-icon bdc-icon bdc-icon--twitter-x-small ">
           </span>
           <span class="content-social-bar__button-copy">
            Tweet
           </span>
           <span class="content-social-bar__button-count js-twitter-count">
            0
           </span>
          </a>
         </li>
         <li class="content-social-bar__item">
          <a class="content-social-bar__button pinterest-button js-gigya-share" data-canonical="http://www.boston.com/entertainment/tv/2015/01/01/wahlberg-poehler-power-ranking-the-year-best-actors-with-boston-ties/PgEyu3UnVPFuy5rHT1FBVO/story.html" data-cid="article_page_top_pinterest" data-headline="Wahlberg to Poehler, Power Ranking the Years 10 Best Actors With Boston Ties" data-omniture="Gigya | sticky | pinterest | " data-provider="pinterest" data-thumb-type="image" data-thumbnail="http://c.o0bc.com/rw/SysConfig/WebPortal/BDC/Framework/img/bcom_logo_with_name.png" href="#">
           <span class="content-social-bar__button-icon bdc-icon bdc-icon--pinterest-x-small">
           </span>
           <span class="content-social-bar__button-copy">
            Pin
           </span>
           <span class="content-social-bar__button-count js-pinterest-count">
            0
           </span>
          </a>
         </li>
         <li class="content-social-bar__item" data-canonical="http://www.boston.com/entertainment/tv/2015/01/01/wahlberg-poehler-power-ranking-the-year-best-actors-with-boston-ties/PgEyu3UnVPFuy5rHT1FBVO/story.html" data-headline="Wahlberg to Poehler, Power Ranking the Years 10 Best Actors With Boston Ties" data-thumb-type="image" data-thumbnail="http://c.o0bc.com/rw/SysConfig/WebPortal/BDC/Framework/img/bcom_logo_with_name.png">
          <a class="content-social-bar__button comment-button js-goto-open-comments" data-omniture="Comment | sticky | " href="#comments">
           <span class="content-social-bar__button-icon bdc-icon bdc-icon--comment-x-small">
           </span>
           <span class="content-social-bar__button-copy">
            Comment
           </span>
           <span class="content-social-bar__button-count total-comment-count">
            0
           </span>
          </a>
         </li>
         <li class="content-social-bar__item">
          <a class="content-social-bar__button email-button js-share-modal" data-canonical="http://www.boston.com/entertainment/tv/2015/01/01/wahlberg-poehler-power-ranking-the-year-best-actors-with-boston-ties/PgEyu3UnVPFuy5rHT1FBVO/story.html" data-headline="Wahlberg to Poehler, Power Ranking the Years 10 Best Actors With Boston Ties" data-omniture="Email | sticky | " data-provider="email" data-thumb-type="image" data-thumbnail="http://c.o0bc.com/rw/SysConfig/WebPortal/BDC/Framework/img/bcom_logo_with_name.png" href="#share-modal">
           <span class="content-social-bar__button-icon bdc-icon bdc-icon--email-x-small">
           </span>
           <span class="content-social-bar__button-copy">
            Email
           </span>
          </a>
         </li>
        </ul>
       </div>
       <!-- / .content-social--bar -->
       <div class="content-well--wrapper">
        <!-- Content Byline -->
        <!-- storyPubDate = 20150101153536 // lastPubDate -->
        <div class="content-byline">
         <div class="content-byline__producer">
          By Michael Nadeau
         </div>
         <div class="content-byline__details">
          Boston.com Correspondent | 01.01.15 | 10:35 AM
         </div>
        </div>
        <!-- / content-byline -->
        <!-- Content Text -->
        <div class="content-text">
         <div id="adg_main">
         </div>
         <p class="content-text__text">
          Were a fertile metropolis for entertainment stardom. There must be something in Massachusetts water that helps to churn out movie and TV stars like Necco wafers or New Balance shoes. Look who was left off this list for proofnot even starring in Monuments Men and popping up in Interstellar could drop Matt Damon onto this list. Sorry, Matt. It would have helped if either of those movies were any good.
         </p>
         <p class="content-text__text">
          So, whos on top when it came to the Bay States entertainment figures? Lets go through the top 10:
         </p>
         <p class="content-text__text">
          <strong>
           10. James Spader
          </strong>
         </p>
         <!-- adlayer topright: /Boston/Production/BDC/WebPages/homepage.ad-layer.story-asset.dwp -->
         <div class="ad-container ad-container--content-ad ad-container--ad_toprightslot" data-ad-shifted="false" data-position-two="content-well--sidebar" data-position-two-index="1">
          <div class="ad-container__notification">
           Advertisement - Continue Reading Below
          </div>
          <!--Positions: dwc_dfp_position -->
          <div class="ad-toprightslot" id="ad_toprightslot">
          </div>
         </div>
         <figure class="content-media content-media--wide">
          <img alt='THE BLACKLIST -- "Ivan" -- Pictured: James Spader as Raymond "Red" Reddington -- (Photo by: Craig Blankenhorn/NBC) 24crit' class="content-media__image" src="//p.o0bc.com/rf/image_700w/Boston/2011-2020/2014/03/20/Boston.com/Arts/Images/NUP_163043_0710.jpg"/>
          <figcaption class="content-media__caption">
           James Spader as Raymond "Red" Reddington in The Blacklist.
           <div class="content-media__credit">
            Craig Blankenhorn/NBC
           </div>
          </figcaption>
         </figure>
         <p class="content-text__text">
          Spader doesnt often get mentioned among the great Boston actors, but hes a native, and hes having a late-career resurgence like few other actors are privileged to do. His charisma turned The Blacklist into something four-leaf-clover rarea network TV hitand he provided the voice for the
          <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fk24PuBUUkQ" target="_blank">
           Pinocchio-quoting Ultron
          </a>
          in the new Avengers trailer that all of us have watched 10,000 times since it hit. Its nice to see Spader inch his way back on to the A-list where hes always belonged.
         </p>
         <p class="content-text__text">
          <strong>
           9. Louis CK
          </strong>
         </p>
         <figure class="content-media content-media--wide">
          <img alt="Actor Louis C.K. arrives at the Hollywood FX Summer Comedies Party in Los Angeles, California June 26, 2012. REUTERS/Gus Ruelas (UNITED STATES - Tags: ENTERTAINMENT HEADSHOT)" class="content-media__image" src="//p.o0bc.com/rf/image_700w/Boston/2011-2020/2012/09/22/Boston.com/Arts/Images/2012-06-27T071917Z_01_LOA07_RTRMDNP_3_USA[1].jpg"/>
          <figcaption class="content-media__caption">
           Actor Louis C.K.
           <div class="content-media__credit">
            Gus Ruelas/REUTERS
           </div>
          </figcaption>
         </figure>
         <p class="content-text__text">
          Theres absolutely nothing on television like Louie, and thats a great thing; his FX masterpiece is simply the most innovative, thoughtful, and funniest comedy program to come along in a great while.
          <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KFdWcNJ17YY" target="_blank">
           Watch this for proof
          </a>
          , if you really need it. Oh, and Newton native Louie also remains peerless among stand-up comedians;
          <a href="http://www.boston.com/entertainment/celebrity/2014/11/24/somerville-lucky-see-louis/KJq5vQjoepHlABO5RW4xDK/story.html" target="_blank">
           I saw it first-hand
          </a>
          .
         </p>
         <p class="content-text__text">
          <strong>
           8. Elizabeth Banks
          </strong>
         </p>
         <figure class="content-media content-media--wide">
          <img alt="Grace Kelly Award honoree Elizabeth Banks poses at the 2014 March of Dimes Celebration of Babies at the Beverly Wilshire Hotel on Friday, Dec. 5, 2014, in Beverly Hills, Calif. (Photo by Chris Pizzello/Invision/AP)" class="content-media__image" src="//p.o0bc.com/rf/image_700w/Boston/2011-2020/2014/12/24/Boston.com/Arts/Images/25e1548cab0f4f71ac3a2ed55de8c087-53f288a36a234602a96505f55a119ad8-0.jpg"/>
          <figcaption class="content-media__caption">
           Actress Elizabeth Banks.
           <div class="content-media__credit">
            Chris Pizzello/Invision/AP
           </div>
          </figcaption>
         </figure>
         <p class="content-text__text">
          Of course Western Massachusetts (Pittsfield) still counts! Banks Effie Trinket is one of the most welcome parts of the Hunger Games series, and her make-under provided some humor to a grim installment. Walk of Shame might have bombed, but Banks vocal stylings helped The Lego Movie gross $468 million. 2015 could be even better Banks will step behind the camera to helm the surefire hit Pitch Perfect 2.
         </p>
         <p class="content-text__text">
          <strong>
           7. Mark Wahlberg
          </strong>
         </p>
         <figure class="content-media content-media--wide">
          <img alt='Cast member Mark Wahlberg poses during the premiere of "The Gambler" in Los Angeles, California in this November 10, 2014 file photo. From the opening shot of the new remake of the classic 1970s film "The Gambler," a different Mark Wahlberg is on view from the scrappy, uninhibited characters he has traditionally played. REUTERS/Kevork Djansezian/Files (UNITED STATES - Tags: ENTERTAINMENT)' class="content-media__image" src="//p.o0bc.com/rf/image_700w/Boston/2011-2020/2014/12/24/Boston.com/Arts/Images/2014-12-23T163406Z_1258949988_TM3EACN0SRH01_RTRMADP_3_FILM-THEGAMBLER.jpg"/>
          <figcaption class="content-media__caption">
           Actor Mark Wahlberg.
           <div class="content-media__credit">
            Kevork Djansezian/REUTERS
           </div>
          </figcaption>
         </figure>
         <p class="content-text__text">
          Ive made my feelings known about the fourth
          <a href="http://www.boston.com/entertainment/movies/2014/06/26/transformers-age-extinction-lands-with-clank-and-thud/5OBJRzt0alLcAz1GLPnJFP/story.html" target="_blank">
           Transformers movie
          </a>
          , but it still made over a billion dollars worldwide. The Gambler showed much more promise, and his television-producing arm (Boardwalk Empire, Wahlburgers) is still a powerhouse. With Ted 2 and the Entourage movie coming out in 2015, he could be battling for the top spot.
         </p>
         <p class="content-text__text">
          <strong>
           6. Julianne Moore
          </strong>
         </p>
         <figure class="content-media content-media--wide">
          <img alt="LOS ANGELES, CA - NOVEMBER 17: Actress Julianne Moore attends the Premiere of Lionsgate's &quot;The Hunger Games: Mockingjay - Part 1&quot; at Nokia Theatre L.A. Live on November 17, 2014 in Los Angeles, California. (Photo by Jason Merritt/Getty Images)" class="content-media__image" src="//p.o0bc.com/rf/image_700w/Boston/2011-2020/2014/12/24/Boston.com/Arts/Images/459147936.jpg"/>
          <figcaption class="content-media__caption">
           Actress Julianne Moore.
           <div class="content-media__credit">
            Jason Merritt/Getty Images
           </div>
          </figcaption>
         </figure>
         <p class="content-text__text">
          Its entirely possible Mooretrained at Boston Universitywill join Steve Carrell (see below) at the podium Oscar night. Shes been one of Hollywoods greatest actresses for decades now; all thats missing is a little gold man, and shell probably get it for her heartbreaking, devastating turn as an early-onset Alzheimers patient in Still Alice. She was also in a little flick called The Hunger Games: Mockingjay Part 1, too. Not a bad year in the least.
         </p>
         <p class="content-text__text">
          <strong>
           5. Steve Carell
          </strong>
         </p>
         <figure class="content-media content-media--wide">
          <img alt='Steve Carell, a cast member in "Foxcatcher," is interviewed before the closing night screening of the film at AFI Fest 2014 at the Dolby Theatre on Thursday, Nov. 13, 2014, in Los Angeles. (Photo by Chris Pizzello/Invision/AP)' class="content-media__image" src="//p.o0bc.com/rf/image_700w/Boston/2011-2020/2014/12/24/Boston.com/Arts/Images/048d415f73934a99806fec9d8b758b32-34511eee499741e4a19599616a28f5c6-0.jpg"/>
          <figcaption class="content-media__caption">
           Actor Steve Carell.
           <div class="content-media__credit">
            Chris Pizzello/Invision/AP
           </div>
          </figcaption>
         </figure>
         <p class="content-text__text">
          It wasnt too long ago that the Concord native was
          <a href="http://thedailyshow.cc.com/videos/dz4o0c/slimming-down-with-steve---nutrition" target="_blank">
           eating Crisco at a desk
          </a>
          with Jon Stewart. In 2014, all he did was deliver one of the years most unforgettable performances in Foxcatcher. His deranged, layered John DuMont is a genuine American weirdo, a maniacal take on the idle rich gone to rot.
          <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AZ3v7V2CZu8" target="_blank">
           Michael Scott
          </a>
          is a distant, distant memory.
         </p>
         <p class="content-text__text">
          <strong>
           4. Taylor Schilling
          </strong>
         </p>
         <figure class="content-media content-media--wide">
          <img alt="Taylor Schilling arrives at the 42nd annual American Music Awards at Nokia Theatre L.A. Live on Sunday, Nov. 23, 2014, in Los Angeles. (Photo by John Shearer/Invision/AP)" class="content-media__image" src="//p.o0bc.com/rf/image_700w/Boston/2011-2020/2014/12/24/Boston.com/Arts/Images/01823f05be1f4302862c7df1a10e8e5a-d19e6a3e669a4796a0f9b4fbc855d022-0.jpg"/>
          <figcaption class="content-media__caption">
           Actress Taylor Schilling.
           <div class="content-media__credit">
            John Shearer/Invision/AP
           </div>
          </figcaption>
         </figure>
         <p class="content-text__text">
          Its been great to see Wayland native Schillingafter starting out her career in the horrendous
          <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=p59EZkBY2yM" target="_blank">
           Atlas Shrugged: Part I
          </a>
          and the waterlogged Nicholas Sparks adaptation The Lucky Onehit a grand slam with Orange is the New Black. Over two seasons, shes developed Piper Chapman from wide-eyed WASP into a prison-wise force; her brief, unhappy furloughed foray into her old world (punctuated by guzzling a 40-oz. and noshing a burger) was one of the years most captivating TV moments.
         </p>
         <p class="content-text__text">
          <strong>
           3. Ben Affleck
          </strong>
         </p>
         <figure class="content-media content-media--wide">
          <img alt='FILE - In this Oct. 22, 2012 file photo, Ben Affleck, director and a cast member in "Argo," poses at the 16th Annual Hollywood Film Awards Gala in Beverly Hills, Calif. Presented off-camera since 1997, the Hollywood Film Awards will make its television debut Friday, Nov. 14, 2014, on CBS. (Photo by Chris Pizzello/Invision/AP, File)' class="content-media__image" src="//p.o0bc.com/rf/image_700w/Boston/2011-2020/2014/12/12/Boston.com/Arts/Images/5f318ee08c31413993a3476d2dd1edec-f36e9db0970b4111ad8d1aa0fc2dbdbc-0-3631.jpg"/>
          <figcaption class="content-media__caption">
           Actor Ben Affleck.
           <div class="content-media__credit">
            Chris Pizzello/Invision/AP
           </div>
          </figcaption>
         </figure>
         <p class="content-text__text">
          How do you follow up
          <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FtLKn5Y1ulc" target="_blank">
           directing a Best Picture winner
          </a>
          ? You jump back in front of the camera to star as the befuddled, slightly scummy Nick Dunne in Gone Girl, then sit back and watch the grosses pile up to the tune of $344 million. With his Caped Crusader turn in Batman vs. Superman guaranteed to be another blockbuster (although the critical response is probably not going to be as kind) and another turn behind the camera for the Boston-set adaptation of Dennis Lehanes Live By Night, Ben should reside at or near the top of this list for years.
         </p>
         <p class="content-text__text">
          <strong>
           2. Amy Poehler
          </strong>
         </p>
         <figure class="content-media content-media--wide">
          <img alt="BEVERLY HILLS, CA - OCTOBER 20: Actress Amy Poehler arrives at ELLE's 21st Annual Women In Hollywood at Four Seasons Hotel Los Angeles at Beverly Hills on October 20, 2014 in Beverly Hills, California. (Photo by Frazer Harrison/Getty Images)" class="content-media__image" src="//p.o0bc.com/rf/image_700w/Boston/2011-2020/2014/12/24/Boston.com/Arts/Images/457577190.jpg"/>
          <figcaption class="content-media__caption">
           BEVERLY HILLS, CA - OCTOBER 20: Actress Amy Poehler arrives at ELLE's 21st Annual Women In Hollywood at Four Seasons Hotel Los Angeles at Beverly Hills on October 20, 2014 in Beverly Hills, California. (Photo by Frazer Harrison/Getty Images)
           <div class="content-media__credit">
            Getty Images
           </div>
          </figcaption>
         </figure>
         <p class="content-text__text">
          <strong>
          </strong>
          Another triumph of hosting alongside Tina Fey at the Golden Globes. A guest-starring role on the wonderful Broad City (which she also executive produces). A Peabody Award and a Golden Globe for Parks and Recreation, as the show begins its swan song season. Trading romantic cliches with Paul Rudd in the unfortunately-little-seen They Came Together. Oh, and a best-selling, hilarious memoir. If you wanted success in every medium, Burlington native Poehler was your pick.
         </p>
         <p class="content-text__text">
          <strong>
           1. Chris Evans
          </strong>
         </p>
         <figure class="content-media content-media--wide">
          <img alt="US actor Chris Evans poses for photographs as he arrives to attend the UK premiere of Captain America: The Winter Soldier in London on March 20, 2014. AFP PHOTO / CARL COURTCARL COURT/AFP/Getty Images" class="content-media__image" src="//p.o0bc.com/rf/image_700w/Boston/2011-2020/2014/03/25/Boston.com/Arts/Images/DV1690705-6737.jpg"/>
          <figcaption class="content-media__caption">
           Actor Chris Evans.
           <div class="content-media__credit">
            AFP/Getty Images
           </div>
          </figcaption>
         </figure>
         <p class="content-text__text">
          Sure, Evans has developed his Captain America into the most intriguing of all the Avengers in Marvels cinematic universeturning him into a brooding, questioning crusader against corrupted, star-spangled authority. That worked to the tune of $714 million,
          <a href="http://screenrant.com/captain-america-3-marvel-civil-war-movie/" target="_blank">
           and makes Civil War one of the must-see movies for the next decade
          </a>
          . However, what really boosted Sudbury native Evans ascent to the top of this list? His unforgettable role as the rebel leader Curtis in Bong Joon-Hoos insane and insanely entertaining Snowpiercer, fighting through that train with grim determination and delivering one of the
          <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ufzNMqqKCi8" target="_blank">
           more jaw-dropping monologues of the year
          </a>
          . Hes absolutely a movie star nowand also appears to be a genuinely good guy, too.
         </p>
         <div id="adg_main_bottom">
         </div>
        </div>
        <div id="adg_main_bottom">
        </div>
        <!-- Content Text -->
        <div class="facebook-bar">
         <span class="bdc-icon bdc-icon--bdc-circle-logo-small facebook-bar__icon">
         </span>
         <div class="facebook-bar__container">

           Stay Up-To-Date On Top Stories 
          </span>
          <span class="facebook-bar__follow-text facebook-bar__follow-text--secondary">
           Follow Boston.com
          </span>
          <span class="facebook-bar__follow-text facebook-bar__follow-text--primary">
           Follow Us
          </span>
          <div class="facebook-bar__like-button">
           <div id="js-load-facebook-like">
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
        <!-- Related Links Module -->
        <!-- Content Footer -->
        <footer class="content-footer">
         <div class="content-footer__tagline">
          Michael Nadeau is a freelance writer living in Somerville. He can be reached at
          <a href="mailto:Mnadeau989@gmail.com">
           Mnadeau989@gmail.com
          </a>
          or at
          <a href="http://twitter.com/ElDu" target="_blank">
           @ElDu
          </a>
          on Twitter.
         </div>
         <!-- / content-footer__tagline -->

      </div>

       <li class="headline-list__item">
        <a class="headline-list__link" href="http://www.boston.com/news/local/massachusetts/2015/07/13/well-that-one-way-avoid-toll/GsyGzq0plC4vBMujhSGYaI/story.html?p1=Must_Reads">
         <span class="headline-list__link-text">
          Well, thats one way to avoid a toll
         </span>
        </a>
       </li>
       <li class="headline-list__item">
        <a class="headline-list__link" href="http://www.boston.com/news/local/massachusetts/2015/07/13/appears-boston-last-snow-farm-has-finally-melted/M3ag1L8yKTI1iiiWNhHGLM/story.html?p1=Must_Reads">
         <span class="headline-list__link-text">
          It appears Bostons last snow farm has finally melted
         </span>
        </a>
       </li>
       <li class="headline-list__item">
        <a class="headline-list__link" href="http://www.boston.com/sports/baseball/redsox/2015/07/13/ten-things-know-think-know-about-the-red-sox-the-all-star-break/g1siKa3aOuJ7xFZzXQqc0H/story.html?p1=Must_Reads">
         <span class="headline-list__link-text">
          Ten things we know
         </span>
        </a>
       </li>
       <li class="headline-list__item">
        <a class="headline-list__link" href="http://www.boston.com/entertainment/2015/07/13/the-most-boston-movies-ever/UvcIdMBD2liNezcBAGNBcM/story.html?p1=Must_Reads">
         <span class="headline-list__link-text">
          The 20 most Boston movies ever
         </span>
        </a>
       </li>
       <li class="headline-list__item">
        <a class="headline-list__link" href="http://www.boston.com/entertainment/2015/07/13/john-oliver-will-make-you-think-twice-about-building-new-stadiums-boston-anywhere/KmAP3YEbXnU88YtZcATQbN/story.html?p1=Must_Reads">
         <span class="headline-list__link-text">
          John Oliver will make you think twice about building new stadiums in Boston (or anywhere)
         </span>
        </a>
       </li>
      </ol>
     </div>
     <div id="zergnet-widget-30017">
     </div>
     <script language="javascript" type="text/javascript">
      (function() {
      var zergnet = document.createElement('script');
      zergnet.type = 'text/javascript';
      zergnet.async = true;
      zergnet.src = 'http://www.zergnet.com/zerg.js?id=30017';
      var znscr = document.getElementsByTagName('script')[0];
      znscr.parentNode.insertBefore(zergnet, znscr);
    })();
     </script>
    </div>
   </div>
   <!-- / bdc-page-content -->

  <script>
   (function() {
        if ($('#streams-row').length) {
          var streamScript = document.createElement("script");
          streamScript.async = true;
          streamScript.type = 'text/javascript';
          streamScript.src = '/js/hash/93db59b75faad9bb2f71df75c6b2dfe1/dist/stream.min.js';
          var node = document.getElementsByTagName('script')[0];
          node.parentNode.insertBefore(streamScript, node);
        }
      })();
  </script>
